title: Derivative of inverse function given values

content.prompt: The functions f and g are differentiable. For all x, f (g(x)) = x and g(f (x)) = x. If f (3) = 8 and f ′ ( 3 )=9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B39@ , what are the values of g(8) and g ′ ( 8 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3976@ ?

choices.label: g( 8 )= 1 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C36@ and  g ′ ( 8 )=− 1 9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@

g( 8 )= 1 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C36@  and g ′ ( 8 )= 1 9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C48@

g ( 8 ) = 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B2D@ and  g ′ ( 8 )=−9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C2C@

g ( 8 ) = 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B2D@ and   g ′ ( 8 )=− 1 9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D35@

g ( 8 ) = 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B2D@ and   g ′ ( 8 )= 1 9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C48@

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
